snippet: We need to stop competing to tell the saddest story.
abstract: Op-Ed article by novelist Merritt Tierce holds abortion debate should be expanded to include stories unlikely to generate much sympathy; says while public may be willing to accept abortions involving wrenching stories and rare circumstances, most abortions are much more common in terms of both frequency and events surrounding them; maintains a woman who wants an abortion should not be subjected to public scrutiny over whether she has suffered enough first.
lead_paragraph: We need to stop competing to tell the saddest story.

headline.main: This Is What an Abortion Looks Like
headline.print_headline: This Is What an Abortion Looks Like
